comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: Could this possibly be Joseph R. Wilson, brother of Woodrow, city editor of the Nashville Banner? He was 10 years younger than Woodrow Wilson, according to footnote on page 25 of Woodrow Wilson, the story of his life by Wlliam Bayard Hale, found at www.archive.org/details/woodrowwilsonsto01hale

comment.author: 66311327@N05
comment._content: It's clearly him. This photo was printed in The Washington times., February 07, 1913, LAST EDITION, Page 12. The brother of the President-elect was candidate for secretary of the United States Senate. The same photo in The Caucasian., March 09, 1913, Image 7. He didn't get the job, The Daily Ardmoreite., June 17, 1913, P. 1, Column 5 reported that he had entered the service of the United States Fidelity and Guaranty company as manager of the promotion and development department.
